snippet: After creating disorder in his country, Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki suddenly wants more American help.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Iraqi Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki for seeking American military aid to alleviate violence and chaos in his country only a few years after forcing American troops to leave; contends United States should resist providing weapons to an authoritarian leader who has consistently stoked sectarian tensions.
lead_paragraph: After creating disorder in his country, Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki suddenly wants more American help.
